attributes.action: block the Freedom of Information Exemption Bill for MPs, stopping the right of the public from asking Parliament for information. If it were unfortunately passed we petition the Prime Minister to make it the governments priority to immediately repeal it . The public must retain the right to ask information from their elected representatives.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: MPs have voted to exempt themselves from the Freedom of Information Act stating it is necessary to protect correspondence between themselves and their constituents. If such a gap exists in the Freedom of Information Act then this one area should be amended. However, the exemption Bill is too wide and allows no information requests to parliament. It is the right of the public to ask the MPs matters such as spending on allowances/expenses. This right must be protected and enshrined in law.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence –
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/MPs-and-FOI/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
